<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The file access time as reported from the underlying file system.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Also see comments on \\c getLastModificationTime() related to the precision</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of the returned value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#ab258586eab700df6cf494d52dc282e91"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a52f2c3fdd7f80c1991d8c7079489efff">TimePoint&lt;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#ab258586eab700df6cf494d52dc282e91">getLastAccessedTime</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The file modification time as reported from the underlying file system.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The returned value allows for nanosecond precision but the actual</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// resolution is an implementation detail of the underlying file system.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// There is no guarantee for what kind of resolution you can expect, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// resolution can differ across platforms and even across mountpoints on the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// same machine.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#ae807b50b0b414d8a9195cdc0ee23b86a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a52f2c3fdd7f80c1991d8c7079489efff">TimePoint&lt;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#ae807b50b0b414d8a9195cdc0ee23b86a">getLastModificationTime</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#a46987fdc0db0174f80aea26291fde5d8"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#a46987fdc0db0174f80aea26291fde5d8">getSize</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#a03bab17d92e5629864b798aa0d3a37a4">fs&#95;st&#95;size</a>; &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 9999; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Not applicable to Windows, so...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint32&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#a823d8ed4ec65cbd4535f21ee548e839f">getGroup</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 9999; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Not applicable to Windows, so...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/basic-file-status/#a46987fdc0db0174f80aea26291fde5d8">getSize</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (uint64&#95;t(FileSizeHigh) &lt;&lt; 32) + FileSizeLow;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  #endif</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Make \\a path an absolute path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Makes \\a path absolute using the \\a current&#95;directory if it is not already.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An empty \\a path will result in the \\a current&#95;directory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// /absolute/path   =&gt; /absolute/path</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// relative/../path =&gt; &lt;current-directory&gt;/relative/../path</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param path A path that is modified to be an absolute path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a144ec9dcc77027317d16af9fc5fec1c8">make&#95;absolute</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;current&#95;directory, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/path">path</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Make \\a path an absolute path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Makes \\a path absolute using the current directory if it is not already. An</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// empty \\a path will result in the current directory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// /absolute/path   =&gt; /absolute/path</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// relative/../path =&gt; &lt;current-directory&gt;/relative/../path</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param path A path that is modified to be an absolute path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @returns errc::success if \\a path has been made absolute, otherwise a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          platform-specific error&#95;code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a144ec9dcc77027317d16af9fc5fec1c8">make&#95;absolute</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/path">path</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Create all the non-existent directories in path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param path Directories to create.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @returns errc::success if is&#95;directory(path), otherwise a platform</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          specific error&#95;code. If IgnoreExisting is false, also returns</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          error if the directory already existed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ab0231205adf0a10ac89540dbcfdcd2d7">create&#95;directories</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/path">path</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IgnoreExisting = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                   <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82">perms</a> Perms = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82a3653510cd880997f05657d6a95c95db9">owner&#95;all</a> | <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82abd7a1b82d60114b8e940183d37a4ab80">group&#95;all</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Create the directory in path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param path Directory to create.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @returns errc::success if is&#95;directory(path), otherwise a platform</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          specific error&#95;code. If IgnoreExisting is false, also returns</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          error if the directory already existed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a8ba6f296474de05208b3e1cffe779120"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a8ba6f296474de05208b3e1cffe779120">create&#95;directory</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/path">path</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IgnoreExisting = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82">perms</a> Perms = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82a3653510cd880997f05657d6a95c95db9">owner&#95;all</a> | <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82abd7a1b82d60114b8e940183d37a4ab80">group&#95;all</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Create a link from \\a from to \\a to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The link may be a soft or a hard link, depending on the platform. The caller</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// may not assume which one. Currently on windows it creates a hard link since</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// soft links require extra privileges. On unix, it creates a soft link since</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// hard links don&#39;t work on SMB file systems.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param to The path to hard link to.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CD&#95;CreateAlways - When opening a file:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Create a potentially unique file name but does not create it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Generates a unique path suitable for a temporary file but does not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// open or create the file. The name is based on \\a Model with &#39;%&#39;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// replaced by a random char in &#91;0-9a-f&#93;. If \\a MakeAbsolute is true</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// then the system&#39;s temp directory is prepended first. If \\a MakeAbsolute</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is false the current directory will be used instead.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This function does not check if the file exists. If you want to be sure</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that the file does not yet exist, you should use enough &#39;%&#39; characters</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in your model to ensure this. Each &#39;%&#39; gives 4-bits of entropy so you can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// use 32 of them to get 128 bits of entropy.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Example: clang-%%-%%-%%-%%-%%.s =&gt; clang-a0-b1-c2-d3-e4.s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param Model Name to base unique path off of.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param ResultPath Set to the file&#39;s path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param MakeAbsolute Whether to use the system temp directory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#aa37537b95a42a73ea04d8dd2803378da">createUniquePath</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;Model, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;ResultPath,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><span class="doxyHighlight">                      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MakeAbsolute);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Create a uniquely named file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Generates a unique path suitable for a temporary file and then opens it as a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// file. The name is based on \\a Model with &#39;%&#39; replaced by a random char in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#91;0-9a-f&#93;. If \\a Model is not an absolute path, the temporary file will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// created in the current directory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Example: clang-%%-%%-%%-%%-%%.s =&gt; clang-a0-b1-c2-d3-e4.s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is an atomic operation. Either the file is created and opened, or the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// file system is left untouched.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The intended use is for files that are to be kept, possibly after</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// renaming them. For example, when running &#39;clang -c foo.o&#39;, the file can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// be first created as foo-abc123.o and then renamed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param Model Name to base unique path off of.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param ResultFD Set to the opened file&#39;s file descriptor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param ResultPath Set to the opened file&#39;s absolute path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param Flags Set to the opened file&#39;s flags.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param Mode Set to the opened file&#39;s permissions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @returns errc::success if Result&#123;FD,Path&#125; have been successfully set,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///          otherwise a platform-specific error&#95;code.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Represents a temporary file.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @brief Opens a file with the specified creation disposition, access mode,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1014"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// size \\p ChunkSize.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1017"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// were read successfully are left in \\p Buffer and returned.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @brief Opens the file with the given name in a write-only or read-write</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// mode, returning its open file descriptor. If the file does not exist, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is created.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The caller is responsible for closing the file descriptor once they are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// finished with it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param Name The path of the file to open, relative or absolute.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param ResultFD If the file could be opened successfully, its descriptor</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Try to locks the file during the specified time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This function implements advisory locking on entire file. If it returns</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &lt;em&gt;errc::success&lt;/em&gt;, the file is locked by the calling process. Until the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// process unlocks the file by calling \\a unlockFile, all attempts to lock the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// same file will fail/block. The process that locked the file may assume that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// none of other processes read or write this file, provided that all processes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// lock the file prior to accessing its content.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param FD      The descriptor representing the file to lock.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @param Timeout Time in milliseconds that the process should wait before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                reporting lock failure. Zero value means try to get lock only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                once.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @returns errc::success if lock is successfully obtained,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// errc::no&#95;lock&#95;available if the file cannot be locked, or platform-specific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// error&#95;code otherwise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @note Care should be taken when using this function in a multithreaded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// context, as it may not prevent other threads in the same process from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// obtaining a lock on the same file, even if they are using a different file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// descriptor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::error&#95;code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a2b8ef26c55540747c5f83d0cd898fe92"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a2b8ef26c55540747c5f83d0cd898fe92">tryLockFile</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FD,</span></CodeLine>
